creator: 10@email.si
text:
everything works fine, but...
if I switch off directory listing and someone acces
directory witch does not have index.html or index.htm but the directory exists 
(Apache is running as service-with user permissions) then Apache freeze and 
after cca 2minutes the machine reboots ! 

193.X.X.X - - [22/Sep/2002:22:07:54 +0200] "GET /nonexistingdirectory 
HTTP/1.1" 404 275 "-" "Mozilla/4.0 ...
193.X.X.X - - [22/Sep/2002:22:07:58 +0200] "GET /exist HTTP/1.1" 301 312 "-
" "Mozilla/4.0 ...
the directory /exist exists, but IE6 does not return error 301 !!! just reboot 
after time !
if I access /nonexistingdirectory the error 404 is returned to the browser.

in error.log i can see:
[Sun Sep 22 21:17:32 2002] [notice] Child 1000: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Sun Sep 22 22:07:54 2002] [error] [client 193.X.X.X] File does not exist: 
D:/WEB/WWW/nonexistingdirectory

P.S.
I have ZoneAlarm, and no problems startin/stopping the service !
[User with wich service is running have all needed permitions! on all
directories]

any ideas, ok, i know i can switch on directory listing or just simple create 
empty index.html, but REBOOTing machine is too much, what do you think.

Bojan.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Could you please remove ZoneAlarm, reboot your machine, and try again.

Given the other problems reported with ZoneAlarm, I would not be surprised if
it causes other random errors.

creator: 10@email.si
text:
I didn't remove zonealarm but i removed NVIDIA 38.?? dirvers back to WinXP 
driveres, and now it doesn't reboot anymore !
But still the processor USAGE go HIGH for few seconds when I try to connect to 
existing directory in which there is no index.html !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I think this is Apache problem !!!

I figure it out that drivers arent the problem but program nview which come 
with nvidia drivers! just disabling nview worked.

...

Strange.

The directory problem does not sound unusual.  Apache is probably searching
through the directory for files to serve.

Thanks for reporting the problem with the nview program.  It will be here
in the database to help people in future.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
How many files?  If you have autoindex and multiviews enabled, with many
  files in the directory, Apache can take quite a long time to exhaust all
  of the DirectoryIndex possibilities against a wildcard match of each with
  the current directory.  Then it must reread the directory to generate the
  autoindex listing, if that's enabled.

  Experiment with disabling multiviews and/or autoindex and report back.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
10@email.si
text:
nonreal but real:
I had a ONE line: (NOT TWO LINES!)
 DirectoryIndex index.html #DirectoryIndex index.html index.html.var
on apache start, it didnt raise error !!

This was the reason why my machine rebooted !!!!! if i try to acces
directory and directory listing was disabled.

sorry for your time, becouse of my mistacke !!!

creator: bojan@rexursive.com
text:
Programs that run in user space are not supposed to be able to crash the kernel,
unless the kernel has a problem. So, you might not be seeing the reboots, but
the problem is still there (i.e. it was never in Apache in the first place). I
wouldn't stop looking.

Bojan
